intro: Ereminula howellii, commonly known as Howell's ereminula, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its foliage consists of finely divided, aromatic leaves that emit a mild fragrance when crushed. Ereminula howellii is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche.
